import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from pandas.plotting import andrews_curves
source.348244e0:
# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

dataset = pd.read_csv('../input/turkey-economic-social-health-education/combined-indicators-for-turkey-1.csv')

dataset.info()
# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.84501e17:
dataset = pd.read_csv('../input/turkey-economic-social-health-education/combined-indicators-for-turkey-1.csv')

dataset.query('Indicator_Code == "BX.GSR.GNFS.CD"', inplace = True) 

Year = dataset["Year"]
IndicatorName = dataset["Indicator_Name"]
Value = dataset["Value"]
x=list(Year)
y=list(Value)

plt.bar(x,y)
plt.title(IndicatorName.iat[0])
plt.ylabel('Value')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.show()

source.4f5d4553:
Year = dataset["Year"]
IndicatorName = dataset["Indicator_Name"]
Value = dataset["Value"]
x=list(Year)
y=list(Value)

plt.bar(x,y)
plt.title(IndicatorName.iat[0])
plt.ylabel('Value')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.show()

# Creating autocpt arguments 
def func(pct, allvalues): 
    absolute = int(pct / 100.*np.sum(allvalues)) 
    return "{:.0f}%\n{:d}".format(pct, absolute) 

populates = dataset[(dataset['Year'] >= 2015) & (dataset['Year'] <= 2019)]

Year = populates["Year"]
IndicatorName = populates["Indicator_Name"]
Value = populates["Value"]
x=list(Year)
y=list(Value)

explode = (0.1, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)

fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
ax1.pie(y,explode=explode,labels=x, autopct = lambda pct: func(pct, Value),
        shadow=True, startangle=90)
ax1.axis('equal')  # Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie is drawn as a circle.
plt.title(IndicatorName.iat[0])
plt.show()

dataset = pd.read_csv('../input/turkey-economic-social-health-education/combined-indicators-for-turkey-1.csv')

#dataset.query('Year == 2017', inplace = True) 
dataset.query('Indicator_Code == "SP.DYN.LE00.IN"', inplace = True)
# display 
display(dataset.head())

Year = dataset["Year"]
IndicatorName = dataset["Indicator_Name"]
Value = dataset["Value"]
x=list(Year)
y=list(Value)

plt.bar(x,y)
plt.title(IndicatorName.iat[0])
plt.ylabel('Value')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.show()
